email.title: Weekly Digest
email.text:
Hi everyone!
We have an exciting week ahead with IC Hack 19 and the committee is super-busy preparing for it. In the meantime, we have one on-campus event this week, _Internship 101_. Additionally, Facebook and Bloomberg have got in touch to advertise their events. For more information, read on!
email.heading: IC Hack 19 Volunteers
email.text:
If you didn't manage to get a ticket to IC Hack 19, you can still take part by volunteering on the day! It isn't easy making an event go smoothly for 400 attendees and every volunteer counts.
To volunteer, come along to our **Volunteers' Meeting** on **Wednesday 23rd January at 1pm** in Huxley 145. Be sure to also read our [DoCSoc: Operations post](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1509850436007222/permalink/2356588118000112/).
email.heading: Internship 101

event.text:
If you're currently looking for an internship, or simply want to know more about the internship process, come along to Internship 101 to find out about companies that are still hiring from past interns.
Gain an exclusive honest insider opinion, learn about the types of projects interns worked on and the interview process to give you the best chance of getting an offer.
Although it's now relatively late in the cycle, these companies offer interesting projects and past interns have gone on to work/intern at top companies including Google and Facebook so it's definitely worth coming along to hear more about their experiences!

email.heading: Facebook Hack-a-project
email.text:
Facebook is launching their 3rd run of Hack-a-project!
This is a 5-week mentoring programme kicking off in February 2019, designed for 1st years of a three year degree and 2nd years of a fourth year degree, looking to apply for a Software Engineering internship with Facebook. Selected students will come to the Facebook office, once a week in the evening to learn about the whole development cycle and build a project as a team via a hackathon!
In addition, we will be sharing tips on “how to crush your coding interview”, and also do a mock interview with you, where feedback will be provided to help you improve.
Each session will also be catered, so come hungry (to learn and to eat!)
**If you are interested, please sign-up by following [this](https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__hackaproject2019.splashthat.com_&d=DwMF-g&c=5VD0RTtNlTh3ycd41b3MUw&r=4Ht1aWc8IssynPN9692iKw&m=3QnJFgqZ2ln3T1h10vEd1PXGLEETEPLoEWP_HRlZc9k&s=rGe1mlmZqLK51_y0Ld3_wzqoa2xekf0TsLzs_VBIJ2E&e=) link AND send your CV to LucyKemp@fb.com with the subject headline ‘Hack-a-project – applicant 2019’.**
**The deadline for applications is the 1st of Feb.**
email.heading: Discover Bloomberg

event.location: Bloomberg LP, 3 Queen Victoria Street, London, EC4N 4TQ
event.text:
Bloomberg Women in Technology are pleased to invite you to '**Discover Bloomberg**' on **6th February**.
**Bloomberg Women in Technology (BWIT)** is an employee network focused on encouraging increased participation of women and other underrepresented groups in technology. The goal of the community is to offer a strong support network, encourage community members to continuously pursue technical advancement and leadership, helping to inspire the next generation of girls in STEM.
Starting at 3pm, you will get a **tour of our fantastic office space**, gain insight into our Software Engineering department, and learn more about life at Bloomberg through **1-2-1 shadowing** with an engineer and our **panel discussion**. And, if this sparks your interest in a career at Bloomberg, our recruitment team will be on hand to talk to you about the Software Engineering positions available to you.
Spaces for this event are limited. We therefore ask you to complete the registration form by **28th January**. Spots will be confirmed on **31st January** and we will then reach out to you to arrange any travel assistance that you may need.
Please sign up via http://tinyurl.com/ydy8aaj4.
